go_data.justification: Nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells (NF-kappaB) is a protein complex that functions as a transcription factor.
NF-kappaB plays an important role in regulating the immune response to infections.
In the inactivated state, NF-KB is present in the cytosol, linked to an inhibitory protein.
NF-kappaB is available after IKK-mediated phosphorylation and degradation of IkappaBalpha, allowing it to translocate to the nucleus.
NFkappaB activation in skeletal muscle determines muscle degeneration and inhibits regeneration in dystrophic muscles.
NF-kappaB inhibits myogenic differentiation through the accumulation of cyclin D1 and the activation of YinYang1 (YY1), a negative regulator of myogenesis.
